meanings.definition: Frowzier (comparative adjective): more untidy or unkempt in appearance
meanings.sent1: The old scarecrow looked even frowzier after the storm.
meanings.sent2: Her hair gets frowzier when she doesn't brush it.
meanings.sent3: The frowzier the room, the more the cat seemed to enjoy it.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a frowzier version of its former self.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house grew frowzier with each passing year.

meanings.definition: Frowzier (adverb): in a more untidy or unkempt manner
meanings.sent1: She dressed frowzier than usual for the costume party.
meanings.sent2: The children played frowzier when their parents were not around.
meanings.sent3: The wind blew frowzier as the storm approached.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted frowzier when feeling uninspired.
meanings.sent5: The room smelled frowzier as the garbage piled up.

meanings.definition: Frowzier (noun): a person or thing that is untidy or unkempt
meanings.sent1: The old man was known in the village as the frowzier of the two brothers.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house was a frowzier compared to the rest of the street.
meanings.sent3: The cat considered the messy room a playground for frowziers.
meanings.sent4: The garden gnome stood proudly among the frowziers in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The frowzier in the group always seemed to find the most interesting treasures.
